         <h1>
          Looking into the Future of Digital Marketing
         </h1>
         <h2>
          <img src="/images/bio_photos/karin.jpg"/>
          <br/>
          <br/>
          <b>
           Karin von Abrams
           <br/>
           Senior Analyst
          </b>
          <br/>
          <br/>
         </h2>
         <div id="articleInfo">
          June 23, 2009
          <span class="thin">
           |
          </span>
          <a href="/articles/results.aspx?t=1040">
           Advertising &amp; Marketing
          </a>
         </div>
         <div id="articleToolShare">
          <ul id="articleTool">
           <li data-analytics="article_toolbar_share" id="shareTxt">
            Share
            <span class="gp-share st_googleplus_custom" data-analytics="ST-gpShare2" displaytext="Google +">
            </span>
            <span class="in-share st_linkedin_custom" data-analytics="ST-inShare2" displaytext="LinkedIn">
            </span>
            <span class="fb-share st_facebook_custom" data-analytics="ST-fbShare2" displaytext="Facebook">
            </span>
            <span class="tw-share st_twitter_custom" data-analytics="ST-twShare2" displaytext="Twitter" st_via="eMarketer">
            </span>
           </li>
           <li id="email">
            <a href="/Articles/Email.aspx?R=1007149" id="emailLink">
             Email
            </a>
           </li>
           <li id="print">
            <a href="/Articles/Print.aspx?R=1007149" id="printLink">
             Print
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <p>
          The Future of Digital Marketing conference, presented by
          <a href="http://www.econsultancy.com/" target="blank">
           Econsultancy
          </a>
          , is an annual fixture on the London marketing calendar. This years gathering again boasted a number of stimulating presentations, as well as heated discussion.
         </p>
         <p>
          After the opening keynote, four hour-long sessions were devoted to the travel, financial services, retail and publishing industries.
         </p>
         <p>
          These were the themes of the day:
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           The Future of Digital Marketing Is the Future of Marketing
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Digital channels are increasingly crucial for all advertising and other communications with consumers. In fact, the word digital is becoming superfluous.
         </p>
         <p>
          <img alt="Marketers Worldwide Who Are Shifting Funds from Traditional to Digital Media, by Type, Q1 2009 (% of respondents)" src="/images/chart_gifs/103001-104000/103449.gif"/>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           The Future is UnknowableBut Its Already Here
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Few speakers were prepared to predict the future. But speakers and delegates seemed to share a sense of what it will be like.
         </p>
         <p>
          Within a few years, one or two genuinely new technologies will burst on the scene. But most innovations in marketing will be new applications of technologies already available, such as using Google Earth more to provide local context for travel destinations online, or using augmented-reality programs in mobile phones to display full product and price information for items viewed in the physical world.
         </p>
         <p>
          <img alt="Percent of Media Budget Allocated to Online Media According to US Marketers, Q1 2009 (% of respondents)" src="/images/chart_gifs/103001-104000/103377.gif"/>
         </p>
         <p>
          <b>
           Respect Is Key
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          In a world of behavioral targeting and the mountains of information being amassed about Internet users, transparency is more important than ever.
         </p>
         <p>
          Top tips:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Relevance for consumers means respecting their declared preferences, the explicit permissions they give and their right to privacy. Take the high ground.
          </li>
          <li>
           Give people access to their own information. That breeds trust and will lower resistance to marketing messages.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Going Back to Basics
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          A recurring refrain in all the industry sessions. Marketers of all stripes, dogged by the recession and overwhelmed by the plethora of digital tools and channels available, need to get the essentials right.
         </p>
         <p>
          Top tips:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Website optimization. Know whats working, and fix whats not. Ease of use for consumers is increasingly important. Make sure navigation and content are efficient and up to date, and remove dead links.
          </li>
          <li>
           Consistent, end-to-end branding.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure your products, services and USP are crystal clear to consumers.
          </li>
          <li>
           Make simple, clear calls to action.
          </li>
          <li>
           Set deadlines and keep them. Work backward from where you want your business to be in six months to establish marketing plans. If you cant see reaching the goal you set, rethink the goal.
          </li>
          <li>
           Concentrate on home markets first. Get those right before rolling out elsewhere.
          </li>
          <li>
           Search: It may not be sexy, but it remains the lifeblood of marketing.
          </li>
          <li>
           Dont average cost-per-click data over entire campaigns. To see underlying patterns, you need to get granular.
          </li>
          <li>
           Make your money go further. Assess the media you own (content assets, Website and so on), the media you buy and the media exposure you earn (mentions in major newspapers or industry news sources, for example). Maximizing coverage of your owned and bought media in the press can multiply your exposure many-fold.
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <b>
           Basics Arent Enough
          </b>
         </p>
         <p>
          Somewhat paradoxically, this theme went hand in hand with hard advice on Web analytics, clarity, brand consistency and leveraging existing assets. Many speakers stressed the importance of getting beyond the predictable and the merely adequate to deliver an unexpected, higher-value consumer experienceaka magic.
         </p>
         <p>
          Top tips:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Think high value, not high volume.
          </li>
          <li>
           Avoid fake personalization. If you claim to act on your customers declared interests, make sure it shows. Tailor content to your site visitors and the recipients of your e-mail campaigns.
          </li>
          <li>
           Empower your advocates, and provide tools they can use to spread the word.
          </li>
          <li>
           Cool tools are best, such as iPhone applications or widgets that make key activities portable, easily accessibleand fun.
          </li>
          <li>
           Use an element of surprise to spark excitement and interest. If you run a travel site, delivering one unexpected, intriguing option in an otherwise predictable list of hotels in Florida can remind users of something often forgotten these days: Serendipity is central to the online experience.
          </li>
         </ul>

         </div>

          </p>

      <script>
       $(document).ready(function(){

	// Make min-height of left column equal the height of the right column
	var rightHeight = $("#articleRight .clearCol").offset().top + 100;
	$("#articleLeft").css("min-height", rightHeight);

	var stopStick2 = null;
	var widgetHeight = null;
	var absIt = null;
	var spacer = $("#spacer");
	var socialLeft = $("#sharingLeft");

	// find the charts and interview headshots &amp; label accordingly
	var isChart = $("#articleLeft img[src*='chart']");
	var isNotChart = $("#articleLeft img:not([src*='chart']");

	isChart.addClass("chart");
	isNotChart.addClass("nonChart");

	$("#articleLeft img.chart").first().addClass("chart1");
	$("#articleLeft p").slice(0,2).addClass("leadPara");

	(function ($) {
 
        var promo = $("#articlePromo");

        // Wait for page structure to load
        // then find top position of articlePromo
        setTimeout(function(){
			widgetHeight = $("#sharingLeft").height();
			stopStick2 = $("#stopStick").offset().top - (widgetHeight + 65);
			absIt = $("#stopStick").offset().top - (widgetHeight + 355);
		},400);

        var scrollContext = function (element) {
            this.isFixed = false;
            this.isAbs = false;
            this.startingPoint = element.offset().top - 49;
            this.element = element;
        }
     
        scrollContext.prototype.getCss = function (scrollbarPosition) {
     
            var shouldBeFixed = scrollbarPosition &gt; this.startingPoint;
            var shouldBeAbs = scrollbarPosition &gt; stopStick2;
     
            if (shouldBeFixed == true &amp;&amp; this.isFixed == false &amp;&amp; shouldBeAbs == false) {
                this.isFixed = true;
                this.isAbs = false;
                $("#spacer").show();
                return {
                    position: 'fixed',
                    top: 0,
                    left: 'auto',
                    'padding-top': '30px',
                    width: this.element.width()
                };
            }
     
            if (shouldBeFixed == false &amp;&amp; shouldBeAbs == false &amp;&amp; this.isFixed == true) {
                this.isFixed = false;
                this.isAbs = false;
                $("#spacer").hide();
                return {
                	position: 'static',
                    'padding-top': '0'
                };
            }

            if (shouldBeFixed == true &amp;&amp; this.isFixed == true &amp;&amp; shouldBeAbs == true) {
                this.isFixed = false;
                this.isAbs = true;
                return {
                    position: 'absolute',
                    top: absIt
                };
            }
     
            return null;
        };

     
        $.fn.floatingElement = function () {
          
            return this.each(function () {
                var element = $(this);
                var context = new scrollContext(element);
                var w = $(window);
     
                w.scroll(function () {
                    var scrollbarPosition = w.scrollTop();
                    var newCss = context.getCss(scrollbarPosition);
     
                    if (newCss !== null) {
                        element.css(newCss);
                    }
                   
                });
            });
        };
    })(jQuery);

	setTimeout(function(){

		// Place the first image and left col social container
		var firstLead = $("#articleLeft p.leadPara").first();
		var lastLead = $("#articleLeft p.leadPara").last();
		spacer.insertAfter(lastLead);
		$(".chart1").insertAfter(firstLead);
		$("#articleLeft img.nonChart").parent().addClass("nonChartContainer");
		socialLeft.insertAfter(lastLead);
		socialLeft = $("#sharingLeft");
		$("#sharingLeft").floatingElement();

	}, 300);

	(function ($){
		
		var addThisAvailable;

		// Check every 100ms to see if the social widget is on page
		addThisAvailable = setInterval(function() {

			// If it is on page, move it to the left col social container
		    if ($("#sharebar").length &gt; 0) { 

			    $("#sharebar").appendTo("#sharingLeft");
				
				// Its in the right spot, so stop checking				
				clearInterval(addThisAvailable);

                         //Add st_via
                         $(".st_twitter_stbar").attr("st_via", "eMarketer");

			} else {

				// Need logic to kill the first statement if it never gets there

			}			

		}, 100);

	}(jQuery));
	
	$(window).resize(function() {
	    setTimeout(function(){

			// update the stop point for social widget
			stopStick2 = $("#stopStick").offset().top - 348;
			widgetHeight = $("#sharingLeft").height();
			absIt = stopStick2 - (widgetHeight + 55);

	    }, 100);
	});	

	$("#share").click(function(){
		$("#articleToolsShare").animate({
			right: "1px"
		}, 200);
	});

	$("#cancelShare").click(function(){
		$("#articleToolsShare").animate({
			right: "-323px"
		}, 200);
		return false;
	});

	// Create the tooltip
	// Save article title in data
	$(".articlePagination li a").each( function() {
	    var $this = $(this);
	    $this.data("title",$this.attr("title"));
	    $this.removeAttr("title");

	    //update the text in the tooltip
		var prevTitle = $(".prev a").data("title");
		var nextTitle = $(".next a").data("title");

		$("#prevArticleTitle p").text(prevTitle);
		$("#nextArticleTitle p").text(nextTitle);
	});

	$(".articlePagination li a").hover(function(){
	    var $this = $(this);
	    var title = $this.data("title");
	});

	$(".prev a").mouseenter(function(){
		if ($("#prevArticleTitle p").is(":empty")){
			return;
		} else {
			$("#prevArticleTitle").fadeIn();
		}
	});

	$(".next a").hover(function(){
		$("#nextArticleTitle").fadeIn();
	});

	$(".prev a, .next a").mouseleave(function(){
		$("#prevArticleTitle, #nextArticleTitle").fadeOut();
	});

	// Right Col Tabs
	$("ul#assetTabs li").first().addClass("activeTab");
	$(".tabbedContent").first().fadeIn();

	// Tab switch click event
    $("ul#assetTabs li").click(function(){
        $(".tabbedContent").hide();
        $("ul#assetTabs li").removeClass("activeTab");
        $(this).addClass("activeTab");

	    var showContent = $(".activeTab").find("a").attr("href");
	    $(showContent).fadeIn();
	    
	    return false;
    });

	// set domain to match marketo iframe
	document.domain = 'emarketer.com';
	var seenNews = "no";


});
      </script>
